Prologue
Chapter 1
Vignettes
Arrow keys to move.
Press 'x' to jump.
Press and hold 'c' to slide.
Wow, you're so talented!
Well done, kid.
You're a genius!
How are you so smart? You're so young!
You're going to be super successful. I know it.
Hey! I'm Anna.
Anna Whittaker Murrat. (for the sake of formality)
One of my favorite pastimes is drawing characters.
Here's a favorite of mine.
Unlike a lot of people, I don't like naming my characters?
I don't know, I just call her "farmer girl".
Don't ask my "why the Japanese aesthetic Anna".
I watched Princess Mononoke when I was five and immediately got obsessed, okay?
Anywho, I've got to do some errands.
Feel free to look around though! :)
I'll leave you to it then.
Hello, little one. You are unfamiliar with this place, are you not?
The silent type. I see.
Er.. Apologies, my words have preceded my manners.
I am known as The Scholar. It is my purpose to accumulate knowledge about all things.
If your question is where is this place, well that knowledge is beyond all of our kind. Even me.
Often this place is called names such as "Void" or "Limbo", But I detest verbose words that has no meaning.
You were always her favorite, little one. Shame she brought this upon you too.
Your journey ahead shall be perilous. I shall observe your voyage with great interest.
Godspeed, little one.
The trial is different for all of us. Mine was of knowledge.
I have read and memorized a hundred-thousand books, and yet I remember so few.
You see now why I am perpetually reading. I must do so lest I lose my intelligence
The trial never ends for any of us. You think you've reached your destination but you have not, cannot, will not reach it.
Truly a sisyphean existence.
The road ahead is more treacherous yet.
Some doors shall be locked, and you shall open them.
Godspeed.
Who has disturbed me?
Ah, it is you. The favorite.
No response. I suppose you were designed that way.
I did not think she will give up on you.
I guess I was mistaken.
They call me the musician. None of us have names you see.
I suppose you've met the scholar. He is the eldest of all of us, he was here when she played her first song.
Years has passed since I heard her playing. I guess she lost passion.
I, however, will not. I shall practice until my performance is without fault.
Distract me again and I'll have your head on a platter.
Now go.
